vision.problem: Elderly patients struggle to manage complex medication regimens, track vital signs, and communicate health information to caregivers and providers. Current solutions are fragmented and not designed for aging users.
vision.solution: A privacy-first healthcare companion that provides voice-driven medication management, caregiver coordination, and seamless provider communication while keeping sensitive health data encrypted and under user control.
vision.scope: In scope: medication tracking, vital signs, caregiver alerts, provider summaries. Out of scope: diagnosis, treatment recommendations, emergency response dispatch.
successMetrics: Brenda can look up medications by voice without errors
David receives timely alerts when mom misses medications
Dr. Evans can access patient summaries securely
System works fully offline for core features

personas.name: Brenda
personas.description: 82-year-old woman managing multiple chronic conditions (hypertension, diabetes, arthritis). Lives alone but wants to maintain independence. Limited tech experience but motivated to stay healthy.
personas.keyNeed: Simple, reliable way to manage 8+ daily medications without confusion
personas.frustration: Current apps have tiny text, complex navigation, and require internet connection

personas.name: David
personas.description: 52-year-old adult son who lives 30 minutes away. Works full-time but worries about his mother. Needs peace of mind that she's taking medications and staying healthy.
personas.keyNeed: Real-time visibility into mom's health without being intrusive
personas.frustration: Has to call multiple times daily to check if mom took her pills

personas.name: Dr. Evans
personas.description: Primary care physician managing 2000+ patients. Has 15-minute appointment slots. Needs quick access to patient health trends.
personas.keyNeed: Actionable health summaries that surface concerns quickly
personas.frustration: Patients bring incomplete or inaccurate medication lists to appointments

customMetrics.name: PHI Exposure Count
customMetrics.command: grep -rn 'bloodPressure\|heartRate\|medications' packages/ | grep -v '.spec.ts' | grep -v 'node_modules' | grep -v '.d.ts' | wc -l | tr -d ' '
